title: Challenges finding information in food and agriculture on the Web: what can we do better?

tasks.task: Panel at DCMI 2020 on Challenges in Food and Agriculture Information
subtasks: Introduce Erin Antonioli from USDA NAL
Present AgData Commons as a catalog and repository for USDA-funded research data
Highlight key features of AgData Commons (e.g., metadata standards, search, access, DOI tagging)
Address challenges in metadata requirements balance
Discuss role of controlled vocabularies and the USDA's NAL Thesaurus
Explain AgCross integration and data.gov submission processes
Brief on challenges like search performance, multilingualism, and linked data integration

tasks.task: Fabrizio Celli from FAO on AGRIS Database
subtasks: History and evolution of AGRIS (1974 initiative, now over 400 data providers)
Challenges in integrating data from diverse sources (difficulties in metadata quality, encoding, and multilingualism)
Data integration processes, including manual validation, format conversion, and metadata enrichment
Use of AGRAVOC for classification and multilingual search enhancement
Strategies for dealing with automatic data ingestion and harvesting

tasks.task: Shio-Yin King from Beijing Academy of Agriculture's presentation (via video)
subtasks: Overview of agricultural information resource construction at BAFS, including Beijing Agriculture Think Tank Platform
Challenges in resource construction (data from multiple sources, language issues, metadata standards)
Standardization efforts using STCourse vocabulary and core metadata models
Plans for future AI/AK and multilingual unified retrieval

tasks.task: Medha Devare from IFPRI on CGIR Big Data Platform
subtasks: Introduction of CGIAR's 15 centers and focus on poverty reduction, food security
Challenges in open data and FAIR standards adoption in research
Data discovery portal (Guardian) and interoperable data from various sources (USDA, World Bank, gene banks)
FAIR workflow approaches (metadata enrichment, ontology integration, data visualization)
Broader discussion on cultural change, tooling, and incentives for better data management

tasks.task: Laura Megdaleno from Land Portal Foundation
subtasks: Land Portal's role in land governance data aggregation and standardization
LandVoc (subset of AgroVoc) for subject control, and challenges with multilingual metadata
Strategies for dealing with fragmented data sources and harmonization needs
Emphasis on community building and capacity development for data standards adoption
Call for collaboration to improve data interoperability and promote open access
Panelists discuss recommendations for metadata quality and best practices
Highlight of the need for capacity building, education, tooling, and cultural change
Idea sharing on cross-organizational cooperation for standardization and data sharing
Exploration of leveraging existing vocabularies (e.g., AGRAVOC, LandVoc) for semantic interoperability
Reflection on passing promising on open FAIR data practices and research use-cases
